src.model.hyperoptimize

Helper functions for optimizing model hyperparameters.

Optimizer: hyperopt

src.model.hyperoptimize.crossval_objective(params, model, X, y, cv, scoring)[source]

Objective function for hyperopt.

Uses cross validation scoring.

Parameters:

  • params (dict) – hyperparameters to test

  • model (sklearn.base.BaseEstimator) – estimator to test

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – features

  • y (pd.Series) – target

  • cv (Union[int, callable]) – cross-validation strategy

  • scoring (Union[str, dict]) – scoring metric

Returns:

loss

Return type:

float

src.model.hyperoptimize.find_best_params(objective, space, max_evals, early_stop_n)[source]

Search for the optimal model hyperparams using hyperopt.

Parameters:

  • objective (callable) – objective function to minimize

  • space (dict) – hyperparameter ranges

  • max_evals (int) – number of evaluations to perform

  • early_stop_n (int) – number of iterations without improvement to stop

Returns:

best hyperparameters

Return type:

dict

src.model.hyperoptimize.fix_param_dtypes(params, param_dtypes)[source]

Fix types for best hyperparameters returned by hyperopt.

src.model.hyperoptimize.hyperoptimize(model, X, y, cv, scoring, space, objective=<function crossval_objective>, max_evals=100, early_stop_n=15)[source]

Optimize model hyperparameters.

Parameters:

  • model (sklearn.base.BaseEstimator) – estimator to test

  • objective (callable) – objective function to minimize

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – features

  • y (pd.Series) – target

  • cv (Union[int, callable]) – cross-validation strategy

  • scoring (Union[str, dict]) – scoring metric

  • space (list[namedtuple]) – named tuples with the following fields: name, value, min, max, type

  • max_evals (int) – max number of evaluations to perform

  • early_stop_n (int) – number of iterations without improvement to stop

Returns:

best hyperparameters

Return type:

dict

src.model.hyperoptimize.make_param_mapping(params, mapper, prefix='calibratedclassifiercv__estimator__')[source]

Make a parameter space from a list of named tuples.

Parameters:

  • params (list[namedtuple]) – named tuples with the following fields: name, value, min, max, type

  • mapper (callable) – a function that converts a named tuple to a key-value pair

  • prefix (str) – the prefix to add to the key

Returns:

hyperparameter space

Return type:

dict

src.model.hyperoptimize.map_name_to_param(param, prefix)[source]

Map a hyperparameter name to its distribution or value.

Parameters:

  • param (namedtuple) – a named tuple with the following fields: name, value, min, max

  • prefix (str) – the prefix to add to the key

Returns:

a key-value pair for the hyperparameter

Return type:

tuple

src.model.hyperoptimize.map_name_to_type(param, prefix)[source]

Map a hyperparameter name to its type.

Parameters:

  • param (namedtuple) – a named tuple with the following fields: name, type

  • prefix (str) – the prefix to add to the key

Returns:

a key-value pair for the parameter type

Return type:

tuple
